website_summaries.verdict: If you want an alternative to plastic models and don't mind the price, it's a reasonable choice.
pros: A durable design constructed of a steel exterior and rubber interior seals
cons: The most expensive model on our list, but not the best at odor control or capacity – only holds 50 diapers

customer_reviews.title: Add a gas mask to your cart when purchasing the Ubbi diaper pail
customer_reviews.text: Why a one star? I’m rating it based on the manufacturer title. “Odor locking”. When you advertise a diaper pail that traps in the smell but it does the exact opposite you deserve a fair rating. Every time you open the poop door prepare yourself for your little ones marination of atomic diapers waft into the room. Unreal, unreal! Really Ubbi baby engineers, you didn’t think of making a secondary trap door that would be the initial diaper holding area until the main door is shut, a simple slice valve would do it. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy doesn't hold in the smell.
customer_reviews.text: I heard these were really good and they kept the smell in... I heard wrong. This is a terrible product and made my whole house smell. At first I thought maybe we weren't using it correctly. Both my husband and I looked through the instructions to make sure and everything is right. It doesn't hold in the smell at all and make our house stink when inside. It sit outside now which is where it will spend the rest of its days and I will be buying another diaper pail. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: G. Mickelsen

customer_reviews.title: Poop storm
customer_reviews.text: I assumed that the metal material in this trash can wouldn’t hold smells the way plastic does, but I was wrong! At the end of the day when you take the trash out you’re entire house ends up smelling like poop and the trash can itself has to be deodorized everyday. Indontnhave the time for that with a newborn and a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Wade

customer_reviews.title: These ROCK!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have three of these diaper pails in our house, for good reason. We have two kids under two and we go through a LOT of diapers. I love how you can use ANY kind of trash bag you want with these (hec, you could even use grocery bags if you wanted to) but it just makes it an easy choice for a diaper pail to have around. When my kids out grow diapers, I will probably still keep one around to use for the kitty's litter box clean up bags, which I already drop in the diaper pail anyway with my kid's diapers! HAHA! HIGHLY recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Katie ATop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost - no lingering smells
customer_reviews.text: This is a great diaper pail. My baby came home from the NICU on home oxygen, so we unfortunately had to set up camp downstairs out of convenience. We got so lazy with midnight diaper changes so we just moved the diaper pail into the living room where we hang out 24/7 (gross!). After a week of having our baby home, I realized that there were NO smells even when completely packed with dirty diapers. Impressive. Also like that we don't need special bags... Regular garbage bags will do. Study and cute colors. Easy to throw diapers away one-handed. Pricy but worth the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah P.

customer_reviews.title: It is light, sturdy, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great purchase! I know it is a sightly bigger expence then some of the other options but it has been worth it. The look is clean and sleek. It is light, sturdy, and easy to use. I really love that you dont have to buy specialty bags for it to work well and this helps with $$ over time. The BEST part is that no smells, NONE, get out into the house. I am very sensitive to smell and in the months since we purchased the Ubbi I have not noticed a single smell. I dont care the price I paid, my house and babies room dont make me uncomfortable. So worth it!
customer_reviews.author: ATX-Kellybeth

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: We had an arm and hammer diaper pail with our other kids and you would have to shove the diaper in a little hole and hope it doesn’t explode all over you. And it STUNK!! This one is great. It smells for a second when you slide it open (it’s full of dirty diapers tho so as to be expected) but you just drop the diaper right in! I love that you just use a regular old trash bag. I always get the febreeze ones so that helps a bit withthe smell. My husband KEEPS saying how surprised he is by how much he likes this pail.
customer_reviews.author: asmith1021

customer_reviews.title: Diaper pail aired out over night once every single week for one year...but it mildewed anyway!
customer_reviews.text: This diaper pail has great function and aesthetics, but after one year of use it has mildew in every crevice. Every crevice of this device is filled with black mildew! In and around the lid, under the seal, and around the screws inside the bottom. This is so disappointing since, without fail, I opened this pail up once every single week for a year and aired it out over night. I can't believe after doing all of that it still mildewed this terribly. I can't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself and get a diaper genie.
customer_reviews.text: Everyone raves about this diaper pail. It was awful. When changing the bag the smell about knocks you down!! I’m so glad I didn’t get rid of my diaper genie. It just shows how much better it is then the ubbi. Ps: there wasn’t anything wrong with the DG, I just wanted to try the ubbi and was so disappointed. The problem is that you have to open it so wide to take the bag out then you have no choice of getting smacked in the face with poop smell. And then your house smells like your dog just took a poop. Save yourself and get a diaper genie.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling Price

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Munchkin 2 Step
customer_reviews.text: Save money on bags. Like the size and looks very modern, clean. Cons: -Somewhat difficult to get a massive load out because of the suction. (Holds much more than conventional tear away bags or cartridges. -Need to have it up against a wall for slide feature to work well.
customer_reviews.author: AverageGuy

customer_reviews.title: Stink Bomb Lurking
customer_reviews.text: I have had this pail less than a year and it is aweful. The smell is so strong and lingers for so long. Yes, it only takes a few seconds to slide it open and drop the diaper in but the smell sticks in the room for what feels like forever. We have cleaned and sanitized it and left it out doors to air out many times but that smell comes back within a few days. We previously had the arm and hammer one and it was so much better but we broke the foot pedal and decided to try this one based on the reviews and aesthetics. Bad move! Not worth the price of purchase
customer_reviews.author: S.S.

customer_reviews.title: Nursery Need
customer_reviews.text: I was gifted this diaper pail for my cloth diapering needs when I had my first child in 2015. Since then, I bought another for our second child's room AND I gift it to any expecting mother. This pail works great for both cloth diapering and disposables. In fact, I just purchased for my cousin who is going to use disposables. The metal container traps in the smell and it doesn't linger. I couldn't recommend enough! I even resold one of mine on a swap site for over half of what I paid for, so the resale is great too!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Silvey

customer_reviews.title: Why isn’t it taller?
customer_reviews.text: This trash can is great except I wonder why they chose to make it half sized? Couldn’t it just be as tall as a normal trash can? Doesn’t make a lot of sense, a taller can could also make it harder for kids to tamper with? Anyway, otherwise I like the design and style and it is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Love this so much, bought it for our second baby!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, and to clean! We use regular 13 gal trash bags, which are so much cheaper then diaper pail refills! It is easy to keep clean when it gets a little stinky I rinse it down and set it in the sunshine then it smells brand new! Love the lock so my nosey toddler can't open it and play in it! His room never stinks, it holds in the smells! We loved it so much we are buying another one for our newest addition since big brother is still using his!
customer_reviews.author: Erin B.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for diapers and Dog Pick Up Bags and No Special Bags needed!
customer_reviews.text: I love that this pail doesn't require special bags. We have a toddler and 2 dogs. We put the pail in the garage and use it for both diapers and doggy pick up bags, so that our garage doesn't stink before trash day. We're in GA, so the garage gets pretty hot and still no smell.
customer_reviews.author: AMitch

customer_reviews.title: Pretty design and nothing else... Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: Listen to the other reviews that talk about how smelly it is. You have to empty the diaper pail every day or the whole room will reek. The biggest issue I have is that it doesn't have a dual door system, so every time you dump a diaper in the pail it releases the full smell from inside the pail. It is a very cool looking design, but nothing else. I'm totally annoyed and feel duped by the pretty design.
customer_reviews.author: Kasia L.

customer_reviews.title: Short
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great pail! The only thing I think is kinda silly is it’s small and it’s not tall so if your child likes to figure things out and get into things it’s definitely at their height to do so... so I was kind of disappointed about spending $70 on a pail that’s supposed to be the best of the best when you can buy munchkins for $30 that are tall and convenient. But other than odor and etc it’s great. Also, take the time to purchase the trash bags... it says you can use any kind but honestly you really can’t. I do love how you can almost purchase any color to match your child’s room that’s about it.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: doesn't look like most clunky diaper pales Stainless steel does not absorb ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros Sleek design; doesn't look like most clunky diaper pales Stainless steel does not absorb odors Incredibly easy to change trash bags Does not require special, overpriced bags- a HUGE perk for me, since my little one goes through many diapers Seals in diaper odors Comes in a variety of colors and patterns Cons Fairly small, but does hold an entire regular-size trash bag of diapers. We have a newborn who is a prolific eater and has roughly 15 diapers a day and we change the trash bag every 3 days or so.
customer_reviews.author: coolitbrittneyTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Great for giant adult incontinence pads (not diapers)
customer_reviews.text: At this point, I am an old broad and unfortunately have developed incontinence problems. I use really large pads, not full-on diapers, but larger than menstrual pads. This diaper pail is great, and no odor escapes. I like that it's metal so it doesn't absorb odors, either. I've had it for several months, and have no complaints. I love that it uses regular kitchen trash bags, I think the others I looked at first that have special bags would be a pain. The opening is about six inches in diameter, so I don't know if it would take adult diapers, but it takes the large pads with no problems. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Upstate Reader

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the stench in, and uses regular, low cost trash bags.
customer_reviews.text: This works great, no special bag required, and keeps the smell down! I was warned against getting a diaper genie, so I opted for this instead. The gray chevron pattern looks great in our nursery, and it's a convenient size, easy to keep out of the way. I also like the lock function, it'll keep our little one from getting into it or knocking it over, also a good idea if you have pets that may be interested in your trash can. It's easy to swap out the bag once it gets full, and really does lock the stench in. Would recommend for any household that goes through a lot of stinky diapers!
customer_reviews.author: Evin

customer_reviews.title: No smell!
customer_reviews.text: I registered for and received one of these for my baby. I liked it so much that I bought it for my friend for her shower. Somehow, absolutely no smell escapes from this thing when the top hatch is closed. When you open it to put in a new diaper, the scent from what is inside with momentarily waft our, but when it is closed absolutely no smell escapes. I was a little confused about it when I bought it because I was so used to the diaper genie mechanism but this is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: We use this to collect the small bags of dog waste from our two dogs before trash delivery. This unit seals tightly closed. No odors. Cleans with a quick wipe down. Use regular white kitchen disposal bags to line the can. Love not having to buy special bags. Does seem small to hold a lot of diapers, but works well for our use. We have the silver one.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine M.

customer_reviews.title: Locks in odors
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this diaper pail. It’s lock in the poopy diaper smell. I just use plain old Walmart brand trashbags and they work fine. Every time I change the diaper pail I just do a quick wipe with a disinfectant wipe on the inside of the lid because it gets moisture on it, probably from the warm/body temperature diapers. Then it’s ready for the next use.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than the Genie.
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to use, and we use a kitchen trash bag and it works. We use ours for the clumps in the cat litter box. When the pan at the end of the box is used we put the clumps in the UBBI. No Oder from the UBBI. It will work for a used diaper stacker as well. How can a nine pound baby produce such a stinky diaper? As moms we clean our babies diapers, then clean the kids cat litter box because the kids use the I FORGOT trick. Kids become adults who bring home grandchildren, and their cats! The UBBI IS A MUST HAVE.
customer_reviews.author: What's up with that?

customer_reviews.title: It was easier for me to just throw in a regular trash bag and run down stairs and throw outside ( good excerise )
customer_reviews.text: I can't really say how this worked . I ended up returning cause we really didn't need this . It was easier for me to just throw in a regular trash bag and run down stairs and throw outside ( good excerise ) . I would definitely recommend if you live in a apartment or extreme hot / cold temps as I wouldn't want to go outside frequently. We're in SoCal so it's not a big deal. Also , no one really sees me in pjs as my garbage cans are next to my garage .
customer_reviews.author: Fashion1904

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as a diaper genie
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work so I wouldn't need to buy diaper genie bags but it just isn't the same. Think how many times a day you have to open it to throw new diapers in. Every time the lid is opened, that smell is going into the room so by the end of the day the room is going to smell. It can handle pee only diapers but I wouldn't leave a poop diaper in there. It's basically just a standard trash can. If all you need is a regular trash can/diaper pale then I would get one with a foot pedal opening instead.
customer_reviews.author: AzonRev

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality control.
customer_reviews.text: We love Ubbi diaper pails. That is, when we can get a good one. They have terrible quality control, and some arrive without being able to get a good seal when they close. The raw stainless steel fancy one is particularly prone to this problem for some reason. This is the second pail I am having to return because it doesn’t seal well when closed, and the lock mechanism kind of grates on the lid when it pushes it up. We have had three great Ubbi pails in the past without problems. But it is really hit or miss to get a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Locks in the smell !
customer_reviews.text: This trash can REALLY locks in the smell. With the lid shut, you can’t smell anything. Some reviews mention how once you open the door, the smell is horrible...what did you expect ? Yes, it will smell when you open the door to the can. It does fit a lot of diapers, and it is nice to use your own trash bags. I have newborn twins, and we bought two of these because we go through so many diapers we were changing the bag every two days. For one newborn, you would probably make it 4-5 days without changing the bag.
customer_reviews.author: abkada

customer_reviews.title: Would not purchase again
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this, based on many positive reviews. I honestly tried to make it work, but had to send it back. My family complained that the smell was horrible. I had to hold my breath when inserting the diapers, which were enclosed in a protective bag. It did not contain the smell, it was bigger than we expected, and the stainless steel part would have been great, if it really did contain the smell. The lock feature was not great and did not always work properly. We used regular thick trash bags, not Ubbi bags.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hardwick

customer_reviews.title: Gets an A+ from new mom
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our daughter per the good reviews (thanks for submitting reviews). First one arrived w a huge dent in the side, returned it and a new one was sent.....w the same dent. Finally figured out that it was being shipped via air and it was so tightly sealed that the vacuum created caused the dent so we pushed the dent out as best possible, it works great and does all it promised. A big win and a big thanks!! I would buy this diaper pail again.
customer_reviews.author: JoJo

customer_reviews.title: How do you even open this thing?
customer_reviews.text: Luckily I have two arms plus two legs because to open the lid of this contraption I need them all. I have to hold the can between my feet and lower legs, hold it down with one hand, and pull really really hard with the other hand to open it. Ridiculous! Am I doing it wrong? Where is the manual? Oh--there IS no manual. Only after I opened the package and tried to operate this thing, I read the reviews: apparently it doesn't hold in the smell either? Why did I buy this? Advise the reader to research diaper pails more carefully than I did, sigh.
customer_reviews.author: Calli

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product that you absolutely need!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this diaper pale for the past 3 months and it’s awesome! My husband didn’t think we needed an odor locking trash bin for diapers— until he changed his first blowout diaper, LOL! Our 3 month old twin boys poop at least twice a day, and I couldn’t imagine not having this trash bin to lock all of the funk away! I laugh hysterically every week when my husband has to take out the trash and he pulls the bag out and gets a whiff of all the stinky diapers that have accumulated! But seriously, this bin is amazing and you can definitely notice a difference when it’s open and when it’s closed.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B

customer_reviews.title: Small, but durable
customer_reviews.text: This can does a good job keeping smells in. But once you open it, beware! Even if you quickly slide and drop your diaper in, the smallest amount of time is enough to flood your nostrils with all the scents it's normally protecting you from. I love that it uses standard garbage bags so I don't have buy anything different than what I already use in my kitchen. It was much shorter than I anticipated and holds less than I expected. If you're using this for one child and are ok replacing the bag often, this should work fine for you. Just invest in some air freshener to keep nearby.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bee

customer_reviews.title: It's great, until you have to change it.
customer_reviews.text: The metal really seals the smells inside and the locking function is easy to use and so clutch once the little ones get taller. However, I do wish there was a hole near the bottom of the can that also had a door because when I have to change the bag, the suction is very strong causing me to have to pull harder and get smacked in the face with the existing, smelly air in the bag. Still, I think it's better than any rival.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Works great for dog waste bags
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what others are doing wrong but the bin works perfectly for me. I have it in the garage for putting dog waste baggies in and I can't smell anything when the sliding lid is closed. Pros: - Reasonable price - Solid construction - Doesn't use proprietary bags. I just use bathroom wastebasket sized liners. - Locks the smell in - Easy to remove and replace the liner The Ubbi meets all of these requirements quite well. No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: ljo

customer_reviews.title: Scent free and discreet!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think that I would be impressed, but I absolutely am. We've been using this for 2 months now and it has been incredible. We've had it in our bedroom by our bed, in the living room by the TV, and in the baby room. Not a single visitor has noticed the pale or any smells whatsoever. It is great that you can use regular bags, but I highly recommend the ubbi brand bags, they are ultra thick and strong. If I could give more than 5 stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: christian neal

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, but stinks! It holds the smell well when closed, but no matter how fast I open the lid, it releases a foul smell that lingers long after the lid is closed. It's easy to install bags, but depending on how full, they can be hard to pull out as they are air tight and the bag kinda gets stuck. My kid knocked it over and crawled up on the side and left a permanent dent in it. I have 2 of then though, one for cloth and one for disposable diapers. Have used them daily for 2 years and will continue with the next baby.
customer_reviews.author: Schroe

customer_reviews.title: Size of the hole is way too small
customer_reviews.text: Cons: I like the look of the diaper pail but I don't like the size of the hole. If you want to put a really poopy diaper inside, you have to be really careful to not put stools all around the hole. I would have prefer to use a pedal instead of having to use my hands, but I knew before buying, that there was not pedal. Pros : The smell stay really well inside the diaper pail though. And I like to be able to use regular trash bags (13 gallons) or a wet and dry reusable liner for cloth diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't help with smell at all
customer_reviews.text: We put one single poopy diaper in here. The very next day the entire room stunk as bad as leaving the diaper out on a dresser. We returned it immediately! It was simply a waste of money because it didn't remotely do anything different than the kitchen garbage can. Actually, the kitchen garbage can keeps the smell in and you only smell it when you open it. This didn't even do that. Very disappointed because my brother told me it was an amazing product. Maybe we got a dud, but we won't be trying again.
customer_reviews.author: DylPickleHawk

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and No more special bags Yeah
customer_reviews.text: as I try to note in my reviews that I always try to give at least 3 months use before I leave a review. I depend on others reviews for my purchases so I try to return the favor. With that said my wife and I love this pail. No buying special bags and knock on wood No oder or rust issues . We have been using it for 7 months and my son puts it through the paces lol.. we use scented 13 gallon trash bags and I do keep a oder destroyer that I get from wally world at the bottom. I change it every 2 month.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: I know this product states it can hold up to 55 newborn diapers but I have not yet been able to see how that’s possible. Unless there is some kind of secret origami way to fold diapers please share your secrets. Besides the load capacity which is decent everything else seems to work good. I find my self replacing bags every 2-3 days, I wish the product was a bit bigger to reduce the amount of bags I use. Good thing I buy my trash bags in bulk at Costco.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas f.

customer_reviews.title: Better than the DG by far.
customer_reviews.text: Had one of these for the first two years of my daughter's life, then bought this one as a baby shower gift for a good friend. She had the same feedback that I had on mine: this is awesome! We both like the smaller profile vs the Diaper Genie, but the real benefit is that this one doesnt require special bags. And, as a bonus, you can put stuff in these that you normally wouldn't in the DG (ie clothing tags, packaging, etc). If you're debating between the two, pick the Ubbi.
customer_reviews.author: Edith

customer_reviews.title: A pail that performs!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pail in concept and it does literally keeps all odors locked in but when you open that bad boy prepare for all those smells to attack you with force. Maybe this is the same with any pail of this variety but when I open it to add to or change the bag I need to wear a mask or run away quickly to avoid the pungent odor. The pail performs as it should, keeps odors in, lock feature is excellent and is visually appealing but I’ll mention it again, I was not prepared for the accumulation of odor when opening...
customer_reviews.author: B4Me

customer_reviews.title: Actually blocks the gross diaper smell
customer_reviews.text: Our inlaws that watch our kids during the day , and they complained that they could smell their diaper bin from the couch (about 15 feet away). So, we were obligated to solve that problem. After plenty of research, this came to the top of the heap. Important points: - Looks as good as any typical diaper bin - Can accept regular trash bags just fine - MOST IMPORTANTLY: blocks the smell - they are happy with it, and we don't have to buy the inlaws any more diaper bins - The can itself is made of of some sort of sheet metal, so it seems sturdy. I can't think of any particular cons at this time really.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Easy, odor blocking, nice looking!
customer_reviews.text: This bin is exactly what I needed! My little just began solids and so QUICKLY we needed something with odor blocking. But, I also wanted something nice looking that possibly could be used after baby. The no special bags was a nice selling point also. It is a nice size, looks clean and sleek, the small opening in the top is easy to manipulate, even one-handed. It completely blocks the, you will know just how well it blocks the odor when you open the top to drop another diaper in and catch a whiff! Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: KAD

customer_reviews.title: Love this diaper pail
customer_reviews.text: This is the best baby product investment I made. I love this diaper pail and I recommend it to all my friends having babies. I've used this with both disposable diapers and cloth diapers and man does this thing hold in the odors! The design is beautiful and looks lovely in our nursery. It is also so easy to just wipe clean if you ever spill a little diaper mess on it. It's also easy for me to open, but difficult for my very curious toddler (and two very interested dogs) to get in to. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Grace Kerrigan

customer_reviews.title: much better than the munchkin diaper pail!
customer_reviews.text: We had been using the muchkin pail for my first daughter. We bought this ubbi diaper pail for my new baby when my daughter was 19 months and ended up buying another one for my 19 month old because we liked it so much! It holds in the scent soooo much better than the muchkin pail. It does release some odor when you open the door, but it is okay when it is sitting there closed. Its also great that we can use regular trash bags in this instead of the expensive special diaper pail bags. I highly recommend this diaper pail!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: We made the mistake of not buying this sooner! A week into bringing baby home we realized that we needed a diaper pail. I went with this one since I had heard amazing things and it is AMAZING. No odors leave this thing. I love that you can use any type of bag, so you’re able to save money. Most importantly it fits a lot of diapers, we take out our bags every 4-5 days Which is plenty! Another thing to note is that it fits anywhere, it isn’t bulky like other diaper pails and doesn’t look cheap either.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Nunez

customer_reviews.title: Great Diaper Pail
customer_reviews.text: This pail looks good and locks in smell. What more do you need? Even with a newborn who went through 15-20 diapers a day, it lasted a few days before it would fill up. I have to laugh at the people who complain about smells when they let this thing fill up for 1-2 weeks. How long do you think you can store poop in your house? My only surprise with the item was that it's shorter than I expected, but I have a small house and the measurements are there for everyone to see so I'm not docking a star for that.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye SMELL!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product as a lightning deal and I would buy it again. I received the same product as advertised and love the 'mint' color. There is no bag liner included, but I love that it doesn't require a special type. I just use a 13 gal trash bag. I also like that is has a locking mechanicism on sliding opening. It keeps the scents locked in, however, I do not put poop diapers in it, as those go right into the outside trash. Great product and I would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Marie

customer_reviews.title: So worth the investment!  Aesthetically pleasing, smell proof, and safe!!
customer_reviews.text: At 12 months, we finally splurged on an expensive diaper pail and we’re never going back. This garbage can is beautifully designed and keeps the smells contained unbelievably well. The lock on top is clutch for our curious toddler. I tried to see if Ubbi makes kitchen garbage cans too, because this design is so great. Couldn’t find any. I will be keeping this well beyond the diaper years for use in other rooms. So glad we made the investment!!
customer_reviews.author: insecta rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Good for about 1.5 years
customer_reviews.text: I initially really liked this diaper pail, but my son is just over two now and this thing STINKS. Doesn't matter how much I clean it or air it out. My son is actively potty training but I am still about to throw thing out because I just cant' tolerate the smell anymore. It was good for the first 1.5 years or so but the smell has gotten progressively worse since then. I would personally investigate other options.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Hi there, mother of twins here, and this diaper pail is super! I purchased it after watching a few videos on YouTube. I really like the fact that you can use normal trash bags (10 gallon size). With two, it fills up fast, but the benefit of NOT smelling the diapers is amazing. If you want a diaper pail that doesn't require special additional products to purchase, then this is the one for you. I do recommend leaving it out in the sun or outdoors for a bit between emptying it out.
customer_reviews.author: amarie84

customer_reviews.title: Ubbi diaper pail is the way to go
customer_reviews.text: Love this diaper pail keep the odor contained and the nursery smelling good, although I do really wish it had an option to have foot pedal to open it. I picked this pail because no specific refill is needed and I definetly have to say I dont regret this purchase one bit. Lots of fun colors to choose from which is another cool thing about this pail. Kinda wish it was a bit taller, but this pail is wonderful
customer_reviews.author: Wubzei

customer_reviews.title: Smelly Rusty Pail
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two Ubbi diaper pails. The pail I use most often started to rust and hold smells after several months of use, which was very disappointing considering the high cost. The other pail I use less often has not rusted yet, but is starting to hold a smell due to daily use. I contacted the manufacturer about the rusty smelly pail and they said they would send me a replacement. I gave them all the information they requested and they never replied to me, despite me sending follow-up emails and leaving a voicemail. The customer service is really lacking, along with the pail not performing as advertised, which is a huge disappointment. I will not purchase from Ubbi again.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: GREAT INVESTMENT
customer_reviews.text: WE USE BAKING SODA AFTER DEPENDS TO HELP WITH THE ORDER AND USE REGULAR 13 GALS SIZE TRASH BAGS LOVE THE SLIDE TOP NO HINGES TO OPEN AND CLOSE EVERYTIME YOU HAVE USE IT LIKE SOME OF THE ONES I INVESTIGATED BEFORE CHOOSING THIS ONE. THE ONLY THING IS WE USE A LOT MORE NOW THAN WHEN WE STARTED I MIGHT WOULD HAVE BOUGHT THE LARGER ONE. BUT THIS HAMPER LOOKS SO NICE ITS WORTH ANYTHING EXTRA IT MAY HAVE COST I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Penny

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper trash can
customer_reviews.text: We had the older model before, too. It held up through 2 kids. Now with no3 I got a new Ubbi, because some of the plastic parts of the old model broke. And I’m so happy and so in love. It feels so much more sturdy than the older model. You need to let it breath twice a week otherwise the smell inside gets unbearable, but after that it’s like new. I love that you can use your own trash bags, that it contains the smell, and that it is (mostly) not made out of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: sweetay81

customer_reviews.title: Good as they get
customer_reviews.text: This diaper pail is the best I've seen so far. Easy to load and unload, has a childproof lock, contains odor, lots of capacity, even looks good. Some reviews have trashed it, saying that when the top is opened, the odor comes out. Well, yes. When stinky things are exposed to air, noses can detect the odor. This one does too. But until someone invents a pail that seals the bag before opening, this one is as good as they get.
customer_reviews.author: Joe from Georgia

customer_reviews.title: Can itself start to smell AWFUL!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst! It looks great, very sleek and easy to use sure but after a while it SMELLS AWFUL! And yes of course I’d you have a load of dirty diapers in there it will smell when you open it. This can however smells even AFTER you take the trash out. The cab itself smell like POOP! I’ve tried everything. We washed it with soap and water, left it outside for two days to air out, I’ve used essential oils, oxy clean, charcoal filters, and the trash can itself STILL SMELLS AWFUL! Ugh. So dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: It keeps the smell away but already have to replace a part in the pail.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Ubbi for about 5 months. Works great in terms of keeping the smell under control but i've already had to get a replacement Ring. It's the ring inside of the pail that keeps the bag in tact. The lip of the ring which is plastic started to warp a little and wouldn't stay in place. I emailed their customer service which was great and they responded within 24 hours and i could purchase ( free of charge and free shipping of course) the plastic ring. Already received it. So 5 stars for Customer Service. Overall it's a good diaper pail but it would've been nice if i didn't have to replace the bag holder so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Liji Villegas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This is so much better than the genie. We have both and prefer this. If we could afford I would have one in every room of house!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Chidester

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This product rusts on the inside almost immediately, despite regular cleaning. As soon as it began rusting, it stopped containing the smell. We are emptying the garbage bag inside daily and wiping out with cleaner and letting it dry, to no avail. We’ve tried attaching odor absorbers also to no avail. I wouldn’t waste my money on this diaper pail again. It definitely has design flaws that need to be addressed. As far as the lock feature, great. Although, now, it seems completely unnecessary we’re having to put a clean garbage bag in daily.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory M.

customer_reviews.title: Not Just For Diapers!
customer_reviews.text: Like a Diaper Genie, this canister has been a big help with family members that use extra Bath Tissue and sanitary pads or tampons. We have a older sewage system and the added paper was constantly blocking the line up. This attractive canister sits next to the toilet and only gives a slight odor, which is why I gave it 4 stars. Use a Kitchen Garbage bag in clear, and works fine to just lift the lid and tie the bag on Garbage Day.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for our church nursery (needed 6 in all). They have been working so much better than the Diaper Genies. They are a little shorter than the Genies and I was worried about not having a foot petal to open the lid, but we’ve had no problems. The lid slides open with one hand easily, and fast to keep the smell in. Love the lock feature to keep curious 1 and 2 year olds out of them. Keeps the smell out!!!! We’ve been using them for about a month now, can go through a lot of diapers on one Sunday, but these hold the smell in a lot better! Win win!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple and perfect.
customer_reviews.text: We have twin boys so we dispose of our fair share of diapers. We originally had the original diaper genie. Held a good amount but gross to push diapers through and smelled. Next up was the arm and hammer one. Same thing PLUS the bags were 20$ for a box' we went through 2 boxes a month and spending 40$ on trash bags seemed ridiculous. This is the pail is perfect. Uses trash bags we already have and locks in the smell until we take it out and i dont have to touch any part of the inside to push diapers through. Its simple and perfect.
customer_reviews.author: rbhgsi

customer_reviews.title: This pail beats all other brands! I LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after going through 5 Diaper Genies (in 8.5 months) because they broke...I couldn’t stand the Munchkin brand, so I returned it immediately...finally broke down and purchased the Ubbi, and wished I had just gotten it to begin with! Firstly, it is made of steel...it’s extremely easy to use, the odor does not leave the pail (I use the Ubbi trash bags which are absolutely worth the extra money), it has a locking feature, and the extra added plus is that it comes in pretty colors! I don’t even miss the hands free feature on this (the foot pedal on other brands) which is why I didn’t buy it to begin with...
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, locks in scent
customer_reviews.text: Does what you need it to do, and that is contain the scent of all those dirty diapers. We change the bag twice a week (to coincide with trash collection days) and never have a problem with smell escaping. I liked that this diaper pail could be used with regular trash bags and did not require you to purchase special bags like some of the other brands. The pretty mint color matches my nursery's decor. Overall good purchase if you decide to get a diaper pail
customer_reviews.author: C Chan

customer_reviews.title: “White” is actually a very pale blue color
customer_reviews.text: The pail looks nice but I ordered white (double checked to confirm after I opened the box) and I received a bluish color. Looked at other reviews and it seems like I did get the right pail, the color is just not actually white. The quality seems great and I know I will like the pail more than my last plastic one. The color is soft enough to work with my white & pink nursery, but it’s noticeably blue.
customer_reviews.author: JMckee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for adult diapers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for adult diapers and it works perfect! I use Glad 13 gallon scented bags and it’s just great. Love the ease of just sliding the door back. A little pricy, but so far, we’ve gotten what we paid for
customer_reviews.author: Stella blue

customer_reviews.title: Love love love it
customer_reviews.text: I used to work in a daycare where we had different types of diaper pails. They were all plastic & they all stunk no matter what. This diaper pail right here is amazing. I don’t smell it at all unless I have it open putting a diaper in there or taking the bag out. I love that I can use regular trash bags not special expensive ones. It comes in a range of different colors & isn’t big & bulky. I will definitely be recommending this pail to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: Works, but the inside stinks.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my broken diaper genie after hearing rave reviews. This Diaper pail does the job, but the inside absolutely stinks. It isn't that I expect the inside of a diaper pail to smell great, but it is like the smell has sunk into the metal. I asked my sister who owns this same brand and she told me she had the same problem. She sprayed Lysol in the inside to help, but it rusted the interior of the pail. The pail also dents easily. Overall, it contains the stench when closed, which is most important. I probably wouldn't buy this again .
customer_reviews.author: John Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst diaper pail ever. You can’t clean it or it will rust because made of steel. Leaks from bottom if you clean with water. The top broke off. The horrible smell never goes away. I’m throwing in trash tomorrow where it belongs and getting a cheap diaper pail.
customer_reviews.author: Kate S

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this product at first. We switch from an old version of the diaper genie. But we’re about 6-8 months in and it really reaks. When you have to open the lid to put the dirty diapers in no matter how fast you are be prepared for the fermented fart smell. We switch the trash bags out about once a week on trash day and then let the Paul “air out” outside for at least an hour then use a scented trash bag liner. It’s not bad but I think we’ll be switching back to the diaper genie.
customer_reviews.author: Brit

customer_reviews.title: Too smelly for the cost!
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for a little over a year and my goodness, I hate it now. It stinks so much. I've cleaned it thoroughly and wipe it down all the time with Clorox wipes and it still just wreaks. I think it's the rubber seal that I'm worried to remove bc I fear I won't get it back in. This does nothing for order. Don't waste the money on this bc in the end it doesn't work like you need it to. And it has no pedal so you always need two hands to open, throw the diaper away, and close it.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because it was on all the "MUST HAVE" lists for cloth diapering, but it just didn't work for us with cloth diapers because the hole is too small... I have small hands and still don't think it's possible to stuff a dirty cloth diaper through the hole without your hands or the diaper touching the sides (and potentially getting the exterior dirty.) We now use a large wet/dry bag over a laundry hamper with lid for cloths and use this for the disposables... I still don't like how small the hole is though (hand always touches the sides.) Oh well. It looks great though!
customer_reviews.author: Liz Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: BEST DIAPER PAIL
customer_reviews.text: We got the Genie for our baby shower, but after months of HATING it, I gave in and bought this lovely thing. I am so pleased with the switch. I can use any trash bag, it always closes securely, and it never smells when closed. Definitely smells a little bit when you throw a diaper into it, but that dissipates fast. I am so happy we paid $$ to buy this. It's so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Dodd

customer_reviews.title: Best Diaper Pail!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I cannot believe how awesome this diaper pail is. As our daughter has grown and started to eat solids, things change in the diaper department and this pail has kept all those icky smells in. Also, we love that you can use the garbage bags that you would by for the kitchen so there is no added expense. I have recommended this pail to everyone. My husband does air out the pail (outside) in between changing the bags due to our daughters diapers changing. This is a super easy pail and really cant rave about it enough.
customer_reviews.author: Heather A.

customer_reviews.title: Rusty in six months
customer_reviews.text: Was quite good four 3-4 months. As noted in the top critical review, this traps moisture and rusts inside, then out. Our surprise: rust and smell issues in just six months. As the rust has progressed, the ability of the pail to lock in scents has failed. We thought we were paying a premium for a pail that would certainly outlast our first child. Now we are shopping again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: Had this diaper pail for 6 years. Keeps the disgusting odors inside while sealed, only to be released during bag changes. Loved that you can use any bag you want. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: New Mom LOVES this
customer_reviews.text: My cousin was expecting twins. At the baby shower she recvd innumerable adorable outfits and many standard baby items. I also purchased (even though this unit doesn't need special bags) 3 boxes of pail bags to keep close by. I kidded her that when she's thru these bags she and hubby will have changed 3,000 diapers! In my thank you note after the babies arrived, (beautiful and all healthy) she wrote that this was her most cherished gift! Who knew? Great Auntie did! ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Jill Horist

customer_reviews.title: An Amazing Product!!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a life saver with our newborn!! So many diapers that we have gone through and the convenience of having this next to the changing pad has been amazing and has made things so much more easier for my husband and I. We have only had it for 2 weeks now, but there is no sign of smell or odor that leaks through. Highly recommend and am so happy to have gone with the ubbi!
customer_reviews.author: Bianca Serna

customer_reviews.title: Did not perform to remove smell from the pads placed in it.
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for the disposal of dog pads after use. The opening hole was too small for the pads or my hand to place inside. The odor emitted was horrible and did not disparate after the pads were removed. It did use regular trash sacks but that use was nothing once it was determined that the can did not stop the odor from escaping. I can only imagine what it would have been like in a baby’s room with used diapers inside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little diaper container
customer_reviews.text: Can’t decide if I wish it was bigger or if it’s the right size so it doesn’t get filled with too many diapers. Never notice a smell even if we forget to close the little door. Love all the color options
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah M.

customer_reviews.title: Can they make one kitchen sized? Best trash can ever.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why this thing has bad reviews. Diapers stink! It absolutely stinks INSIDE of the can but that’s to be expected! My husband and I have our diaper station inside of our bedroom and we never smell a thing until we open it or change it. I am so impressed and I love that it doesn’t use any icky chemical fragrances and that I can use the same trash bags that I use in my kitchen. If They made this in a bigger size, I would buy one for my regular kitchen trash can, it’s just that good. Absolutely worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Ellie Diaz

customer_reviews.title: On our third one
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 - one for reusable diapers and one for trash. Never had any issues with smells in 2 years. Now that a second one is coming, we are buying a third. We use normal trash bags, it locks very easily, easy to remove and replace. No trouble with either one in 2 years!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rumsch

customer_reviews.title: Smells after only 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Does not lock out poopy diaper smells. Worked great for about 3 months, then it no longer kept the poopy diapers smell away. We aired it out outside for a day, sprayed it, added baking soda pucks, but it does not help. Too late to exchange. This was the second Ubbi as I had to trade in my first Ubbi due to a faulty lock. We have been throwing the poopy diapers outside EVERY DAY and use the Ubbi only for the pee diapers. It’s been disappointing as it is an expensive piece.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Devan

customer_reviews.title: A Must-Have baby item!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the best. I tell people it’s up there in terms of my most important baby purchase. Good quality, contains odors, and works with a variety of replacement bags. Plus I think this one is more attractive than any other diaper pale on the market. The gray color is soft and subtle.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle M.

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you receive a new product.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed as I’m almost certain we received a used product but didn’t realize until after I had thrown the box out. I made the mistake of not opening it until later to set up the bag and right away I noticed that smell of dirty newborn diapers. If you’ve ever had a baby you know that smell. So that’s a wasted $60. Pretty upset about quality control in that regard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NO SMELL!
customer_reviews.text: After a month and a half of use I can definitely say NO smell gets out of this thing unless the door is open! The smell in these full trash bags is horrendous when I empty it but can’t be smelled at all while it is closed up. We have our son set up in our walk in closet as a temporary nursery while he’s not sleeping through the night and even in that smaller space you can’t smell anything!
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Use your own trash bags!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to find this product. The plastic diaper pails just do not compare, and I've had 3 different brands, so I know. Absolutely no odor escapes this pail AND you use your own trash bags. No more tying knots on the end of pail refills!
customer_reviews.author: Wynn4821

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: Tons of mildew in the top!
customer_reviews.text: Update: Found tons of mold (mildew?) in the top! Had to unscrew it all to clean it. Been using for less than 2 years. I’ve never used it for anything other than diapers. Check yours!! I love that I can use my own bag! (Very important when stationed in Japan where they have special trash bags.) Looks nice and contains the smell (disclaimer: still in newborn poop stage=not that smelly yet).
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Hides the smell
customer_reviews.text: This hides the smell pretty well, doesn't take many diapers to fill it up though! Definitely would recommend. We also don't have to buy any special bags for this, which I really like - we just use regular garbage bags and they work just fine. I also like that the top can lock so once our LO is a bit bigger she can't get inside if she tried.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Blasi

customer_reviews.title: Way too short!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t speak to the functionality of this pail because I sent it back as soon as I unwrapped it. It is way to short. I’m a tall person, but I think that even someone average sized would find this a little low. With a newborn and diaper-aged children you are already wracking your body; your accoutrements should be as ergonomic as possible, and this one just isn’t. It’s too bad, because I love the idea of the stainless steel. And the sliding top. :(
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Think out of the box, it's not just for diapers!  BEST TRASH CAN EVER
customer_reviews.text: This is the best trash can ever! So we turned around and got a second. No babies here, but it is sleek and easy to use and it is easy to change the bag and easy to use, especially if you are old and just out of the hospital. Amazon 2 thumbs up on this gizmo. Think out of the box, diaper pail yes, trash can after the little gets older. The colors are muted and I couldn't be happier with it.....and if you use in the kitchen the little opening can be closed and no ants!
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: We were sick and tired of smelly garbage cans and then we found this one on amazon ! I was desperate at this point since our son is almost 2 and we haven’t found an affordable one that doesn’t smell gross after 2 months ... I wish I knew about this garbage can 2 years ago ! It works sooooo well! We are thrilled and can actually leave the can in our sons room ! No smell at all, until you open it . So I open it quickly and shut it again . No issues we are very impressed and glad we can use regular garbage bags for it too!
customer_reviews.author: G.B

customer_reviews.title: keeps Odors Contained
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a family member and they love it . They say it has been great since they don't have to run outside after every diaper change and it works well at keeping odors contained. I visit often, and change baby too, and the room and house never smells like dirty diapers. It is easy to use and looks good as well. Yes it is pricy but is definitely worth every penny. Four months and still working great.
customer_reviews.author: CaliRN

customer_reviews.title: Best customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Best diaper pail out there. I have 2 kids under 2 and 3 ubbi pails. They hold the stench very well. I even have one in my living room and it you don’t know it’s there. One of my pail kids broke and they sent me a replacement. Customer service is stellar and totally exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.author: mama

customer_reviews.title: No smell!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this thing for a week, filled it completely up, and no smell! It lasts us a weeks worth of diapers before needing to be emptied. And I like that you can use regular kitchen trash bags with it. At first I thought $80 was ridiculous for a trash can but it's worth every penny when you consider having to buy special bags for cheaper models.
customer_reviews.author: Julia DeVoe

customer_reviews.title: Super happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Really glad after research, I decided on this one instead of diaper genie or others. It’s very easy to use ( I don’t mind it needs one hand to dump the diaper like some other reviews complained, because both my changing tables are against the wall with my body blocking the baby from falling, and I always use two hands to wrap the diaper before throwing as I think that’s really cleaner). It’s sleek looking, small enough to fit anywhere. The vest thing is, it’s so easy to use! Comes assembled and just need to put in a normal trash bag. Saves money and trouble to buy refills. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: High quality and well thought out product
customer_reviews.text: Wayyyyyy better option than the diaper genie! I wish I would have known about this years ago with my first baby! I LOVE the fact that I can use regular trash cans and not have to buy $5 refills!!!! Keeps the stink trapped inside. Just don’t leave the top open for very long or the stink will escape, but other than that, I’m loving this diaper pail.
customer_reviews.author: mddow1s

product_meta.title: Ubbi Steel Odor Locking, No Special Bag Required Money Saving, Awards-Winning, Modern Design Registry Must-Have Diaper Pail, Gray
product_meta.description: Color:GrayThe Ubbi Steel Diaper Pail is made of powder-coated steel to achieve maximum odor control. It is equipped with rubber seals that are strategically designed to lock in odors as well as a sliding lid that minimizes air disruption, keeping the smell inside the pail. To meet the needs of today's parents, this award-winning nursery essential offers the convenience and value of utilizing any standard trash bag or reusable cloth liner. This feature makes it the easiest disposal system to load, use, empty and clean. Offering a modern and sophisticated twist to a once very industrial product, the sleek Ubbi diaper pail includes a child-proof lock and is available in an array of colors. All the style and none of the smell - a promising solution for every nursery. Enter the world of Ubbi where innovative products are designed and created with parents and children in mind. Under the Ubbi name, you will find unique, quality products that are easy to use, helping to simplify parents’ lives while keeping babies as happy and safe as can be. Thanks to its award-winning can of steel, Ubbi is now a recognized brand worldwide. The Ubbi diaper pail is renowned for its ability to achieve maximum odor control and appreciated for offering the convenience and value of utilizing any standard trash bag or reusable cloth liner, a breakthrough in the diaper disposal market. With the same customer focused philosophy and innovative design capabilities, the Ubbi brand is now expanding its signature diapering selection and extending into the feeding category. A wide range of Ubbi branded products is now available for today’s modern parents that are looking for stylish and functional baby essentials. From concept to final creation, the Ubbi team works together every step of the way to bring the best in design and value. The input of every member of the team is taken into account in the development of the Ubbi products, but consumer input is the most important as customer satisfaction is our primary goal.
feature_bullets: SAVE MONEY – NO NEED TO BUY SPECIAL BAGS: No special bags, refills or inserts are required with the Ubbi diaper pail saving time and money unlike other pail on the market.holds up to 55 diapers
MOST AWARD WINNING DIAPER PAIL: The Ubbi diaper pail won NINE awards proving parents and experts approval
STEEL LOCKS IN ODOR: Unlike plastic, steel is not porous and keeps the smell shielded inside
NO SPECIAL MECHANISM – SIMPLICITY WORKS BEST: Ready right out of the box, simple to use and not prone to breakage
CHILDPROOF LOCK: Keeps little hands from finding their way inside the Ubbi diaper pail. Damper mechanism for smooth, hermetically sealed closure

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars5,474 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
